original: It was selfish of me to learn magic.
Start an ARGUMENT with Celeste McCoy?
He’s always hated magic. There’s no reason behind it.
during the attack,after the attack,before the attack

You’ve started an ARGUMENT with another character. During an ARGUMENT, your opponent will make CLAIMS that you need to respond to. Responding correctly will lower your opponent’s CONFIDENCE. Responding incorrectly will lower [i]your[/i] CONFIDENCE. And once you run out of CONFIDENCE, you will lose the ARGUMENT.

Sometimes it helps to speak with someone about the investigation. One character will almost always be able to ASSIST you. You can speak with them about the investigation or ask them where to go next. Right now, Ruby Tymora is assisting you. But who knows? Maybe someone else might help you in the future.
I have no reason to trust you.
What can we infer about the state of the crime scene?
had no lighting,had no customers, had no witnesses
What can we infer about the state of the crime scene?
For certain CLAIMS, you will need to PRESENT a piece of evidence to refute that claim./n/n To proceed, PRESENT the piece of evidence that contradicts your opponent’s CLAIM.
There is no evidence of a liquified weapon at the crime scene.
Which spell did Lord Pierce use to commit murder?

It helps to prepare before starting an ARGUMENT with someone. TALK to Orym or PRESENT items to him to build a PSYCHOLOGICAL PROFILE for him. If you successfully fill the PROFILE gauge, you'll receive more information during any ARGUMENTS against him.
I saw the murder! I witnessed everything!
I came here to reveal the truth and testify against that criminal!
She was wielding her sword after the murder!
What can we tell about how Flinhart died?
What can we tell about how Flinhart died?
During cross-examinations, you can PRESS statements to acquire more information. Sometimes, PRESSING the right statement can make the witness add a statement to their testimony.
In his final moments, he could only think of how I betrayed him.
This juice is worth far more than what I’m offering.

You’ve activated the EMPOWERED EYE. With it, you’ll be able to do more than see the witness’s thoughts. You’ll also be able to affect what they think about. PROJECT items into Pierce’s mind to evoke thoughts from him. You’ll want to PROJECT items that make him think about the murder. Evoking the right thoughts will raise your INSIGHT. Once the INSIGHT gauge is filled, you’ll have everything you need to implicate him.

You are cross-examining a witness. Carefully examine each statement they made and find the statement that contradicts a CLUE, a SPELL, or a PROFILE in your NOTES. Once you identify the false statement, click the PRESENT button and present the contradicting evidence to move forward.

Tyrion will make mental notes of notable clues he sees in the world. These NOTES are instrumental to solving mysteries and progressing through the game. You can check these NOTES at any time by opening the toolbar in the top-left of the screen.
Start an ARGUMENT with Orym White?
Start an ARGUMENT with Orym White?/nYou haven't completed his PSYCHOLOGICAL PROFILE.

Commander White is stubborn and stuck in his ways. He seems to have a grudge against Ruby Tymora and will react negatively if you try to defend her. However, he will respect you if you defend yourself against personal attacks.
Ruby Tymora is a crooked lawyer.

ARGUMENTS are not always fought using hard evidence. Sometimes you need to ELOCUTE to convince your opponent that their claim is wrong. When prompted for an ELOCUTION, choose from one of the three possible responses. The correct response can be gleaned from reading your opponent’s PSYCHOLOGICAL PROFILE.

For certain CLAIMS, you will need to look at your opponent’s THOUGHTS and EMOTIONS. Choose the correct response, depending on the information seen./n/nLOGIC: Choose this option if your opponent’s thought contradicts something in your NOTES./nINTUITION: Choose this option if your opponent’s THOUGHT contradicts their CLAIM./nEMPATHY: Choose this option if your opponent’s EMOTIONS contradict their CLAIM.
Heh… I usually only sell this stuff for 5sp a flask.
